result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. FULLER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Tim Rohr or his residence.

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law.   Transfer to Florence County Jail is authorized.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to any other sentence presently being served.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Initial appearance reset to 10-12-15 at 2:30 p.m.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.
RE:  Timothy Rohr, on 09-16-15.
Search warrant issued.  RE: 2727 11th Street, Two Rivers, WI occupied by Matthew D. Fuller; Affidavit of Officer; Return of Officer.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of burglary and damage to property.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-05-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with Timothy Rohr or his residence at 1718 11th Street, Two Rivers, WI or 160 McKinly Street, Two Rivers, WI.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
